name: finitely
content:

in a way that has a limit or end: This is a finitely generated group of values. The authors of this study investigate the consequences of the policy, given the finitely available resources.
More examplesFewer examplesNatural languages have finite, although very large, vocabularies, and a finitely expressible grammar.In such systems, the speed of information delivery is finitely limited.We need to remember that we are working with a finitely limited amount of money and a finitely limited amount of time.
